channel.title: +MT on आगमे विश्वासटिप्पन्यः

item.title: nonnus-purANa
item.description: Source: TW IMO one of the last of the surviving yavana “purANa-s”, composed just before the destruction of Classical world by the preta, that of Nonnus the Egyptian on his chosen god Dionysus preserves several old strands. Its focus is the “holy war” waged by Dionysus on the Hindus to make them Bacchanalian wine-addicts. However, the account seems confused, melding African peoples, like Ethiopians, and West Asians with H. The Egyptian’s topos of India begins in West Asia itself.
